definition: to taste a small amount/to sample
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to enjoy fully/to experience to the full over a long period
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
to have suffered all kinds of hardships (idiom)
to experience one's full share of sorrows (idiom)
to taste a patient's excrement (a form of medical examination, seen as an act of loyalty or filial piety)/to suck up to sb/to kiss ass

sentences.english: Taste the food before the King eats to make sure it's not poisoned.
sentences.chinese: 在國王用餐之前先嚐嘗食物，確信飯菜沒有被下毒。

sentences.english: Encourage everyone to smell and taste the wines and jot down their impressions.
sentences.chinese: 鼓勵每個人都聞和嘗這些葡萄酒並寫下他們的感覺。

sentences.english: Dental cusp gang Tastes softly crisply Leisure good food Wang Zhongwang.
sentences.chinese: 牙尖幫，脆軟嘗，休閒美食王中王。

sentences.english: Have a little taste before seasoning, as the clams can be quite salty.
sentences.chinese: 加調料之前嘗一下，因爲蛤蜊會很鹹。

sentences.english: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
sentences.chinese: 耳朵豈不試驗言語，正如上膛嘗食物嗎。

sentences.english: The tang dynasty is tea of Fried tea art taste the earliest form.
sentences.chinese: 唐代的煎茶，是茶的最早藝術品嘗形式。

sentences.english: I'll just try a drop, then.
Two of Ross' friends tasted the milk first before they feed Ben.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯的兩個朋友在他們喂本之前先嚐了嘗母乳。

sentences.english: He wouldn't know a good cup of coffee if it bit him on the ass.
sentences.chinese: 他是那種咖啡撒到屁股上都嘗不出好的人。

sentences.english: And they're more likely to salt food without tasting it first.
sentences.chinese: 他們也更習慣於不先嚐一嘗食物就加鹽。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, I didn't try it until just two years ago–and it was great.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次嘗秋葵湯是在兩年前，口味真的很不錯。

sentences.english: In the end, becoming a vampire allows the teenager to experience power.
sentences.chinese: 最後，成爲一隻吸血鬼讓青少年一嘗權力的滋味。

sentences.english: Fang Jian-US point of numerous snacks, taste of the cheek teeth is Liufang.
sentences.chinese: 坊間小喫美點不勝枚舉，嘗之令人齒頰流芳。

sentences.english: Tasting the local dishes of Hainan is a must to a visitor.
sentences.chinese: 對於遊客來說，來海南一定要嘗地方菜。

sentences.english: There is a great variety of food and you may taste a bit of everything.
sentences.chinese: 食物品種很多，您可以各種菜都嘗一點兒。

sentences.english: Perhaps taste is the best way to buy your tomatoes.
sentences.chinese: 也許買西紅柿的最好方法還是先嚐嘗。

definition: to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
